meanings.definition: Agranulocytosis: a condition characterized by a severe decrease in the number of white blood cells in the body, leading to an increased risk of infection.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with agranulocytosis after observing a significant drop in white blood cell count.
meanings.sent2: Agranulocytosis can make it harder for the body to fight off infections.
meanings.sent3: Despite its fancy name, agranulocytosis is like having fewer soldiers to protect your body from germs.
meanings.sent4: In the battle against illness, agranulocytosis leaves the body vulnerable and defenseless.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of agranulocytosis can be life-threatening due to the weakened immune system.
